info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 6:10PM MDT until September 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of eastern Grant County in New Mexico.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water, rocks, and debris over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM MDT, Persistent thunderstorms over the Black Range have produced 1 to 1.5 inches of rain along portions of Highway 152 west of Emory Pass. Expect elevated levels on Iron Creek, and water flowing across the road in places, especially between mile markers 24 and 32. Rock and mudslides are also possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portions of Highway 152 between Mile Markers 24 and 32, west of Emory Pass. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are numerous low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING
